title: rustc crashes when it tries to compile my project on a mac mini m1

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code You will probably get more info checking the repo at https://github.com/gleicon/refluxdb/tree/arrow - it is a branch of a toy database I've built using gluesql and I am trying to port to datafusion. I'm no Rust expert but the error message asked for a bug report, here it is. Hope that helps, I'm available to help or explore more if needed. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` $ rustc --version --verbose rustc 1.58.0-nightly (65c55bf93 2021-11-23) binary: rustc commit-hash: 65c55bf931a55e6b1e5ed14ad8623814a7386424 commit-date: 2021-11-23 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.58.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0``` ### Error output ``` note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.58.0-nightly (65c55bf93 2021-11-23) running on aarch64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `persistence::::query::{closure#0}` #1 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `persistence::::query` #2 [type_of] computing type of `persistence::::query::{opaque#0}` #3 [check_mod_item_types] checking item types in module `handlers` #4 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `refluxdb` ```
Backtrace

``` 🍕 🍺 rigel:refluxdb gleicon (arrow)$ cargo build Compiling refluxdb v0.1.0 (/Users/gleicon/code/rust/refluxdb) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 2 but the index is 2', compiler/rustc_borrowck/src/diagnostics/mutability_errors.rs:450:53 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.58.0-nightly (65c55bf93 2021-11-23) running on aarch64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `persistence::::query::{closure#0}` #1 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `persistence::::query` end of query stack error: could not compile `refluxdb` 🍕 🍺 rigel:refluxdb gleicon (arrow)$ export RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build 🍕 🍺 rigel:refluxdb gleicon (arrow)$ export RUST_BACKTRACE=1;cargo build Compiling refluxdb v0.1.0 (/Users/gleicon/code/rust/refluxdb) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 2 but the index is 2',
